slideInfo.title: Foundations: Legacy and Heritage of Greece
slideInfo.info: Greeks – Gifted in Thought and Letters

pButton.Name: PHILOSOPHY
pButton.popInfo: The Greek people were gifted in thought and letters. The work of Greek philosophers such as Plato, Socrates, and Aristotle are still studied today.

pButton.Name: ARCHITECTURE
pButton.popInfo: As an artistic people, they created beautiful architectural styles such as the Doric or Corinthian column. Many 18th, 19th, and 20th century buildings, such as the U.S. Supreme Court building and the New York Stock Exchange feature similar, Neoclassical, columns.

pButton.Name: LITERATURE
pButton.popInfo: Greek writers provided form and a framework to writing that is still used today. They were the first to write epic poems, such as the Iliad and the Odyssey, and comedic and dramatic plays, such as Lysistrata and Oedipus the King.

pButton.Name: DEMOCRACY
pButton.popInfo: The Greeks developed new political models such as democracy. The most significant version is Athenian democracy, which featured direct democracy in which the people themselves voted on legislation.

pButton.Name: MATH & SCIENCE
pButton.popInfo: Pythagoras, Aristotle, Euclid and others laid the foundations for modern science and mathematics. You’ve probably used Pythagoras’ theorem to determine the length of a side in a right triangle; in your Euclidian geometry class, of course.

pButton.Name: HISTORY
pButton.popInfo: Herodotus and Thucydides originated the idea of recording and describing the events of the past for future use. This yields the basis for historical study as a subject distinct from myth and legend. Their foundational work made your AP* European History class possible!
